alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. John The Baptist; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 6:14AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. John The Baptist, northern Ascension, southeastern West Baton Rouge, Livingston, east central Iberville, west central Tangipahoa and south central East Baton Rouge Parishes through 645 AM CDT... At 613 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Village St. George, or near Oak Hills Place, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Hammond, Denham Springs, Gonzales, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Livingston, Sorrento, French Settlement, Albany, Port Vincent, Springfield, Westminster, Geismar, Natalbany, Shenandoah, Whitehall, Old Jefferson and Inniswold. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 160 and 180. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 37. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 30 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Southern Livingston; St. John The Baptist; West Baton Rouge; Western Ascension
